org.kiji.rest.representations
Class KijiRestCell

java.lang.Object
  org.kiji.rest.representations.KijiRestCell

public class KijiRestCell
extends Object

Models what a Kiji cell looks like when returned to the client. The value property can store one of three things (two data types but three unique meanings):

  1. Numbers (ints, longs, floats, doubles etc)
  2. String literals
  3. String literals that are JSON objects represented as escaped strings.
The JSON string within a value is used when the underlying cell value is a more complex Avro type (arrays, maps, unions, records). For more information about the JSON encoding of Avro records, please consult the Avro spec. When setting a cell value to a complex Avro type, please ensure that the string is properly escaped so that it's not interpreted as a JSON object but rather as a JSON string.

getWriterSchema

public org.apache.avro.Schema getWriterSchema(org.kiji.schema.KijiSchemaTable schemaTable)
                                       throws IOException
Returns the underlying cell's writer schema.

Parameters:
schemaTable - is the schema table used for resolving the underlying schema option into a real Avro schema (in case the option contains the UID of the Avro schema).
Returns:
the underlying cell's writer schema.
Throws:
IOException - if there is a problem reading from the schema table.
